displaytitle: Coat of Arms of the van Heussen Family
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
In graphite, verso center: Clement, Paris, Mai 1878

Collector stamp in blue ink, verso lower left: B. Keller (Lugt 384) 

Collector stamp in brown ink, verso lower right: A.F. von Lanna (Lugt 2773)
catalograisonne: Bartsch 134 gl; Hirschman 285; Hollstein 285; New Hollstein 230

titles.title: Coat of Arms of the van Heussen Family

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Bernhard Keller [1789-1870, Lugt 384]; sale of his collection, Stuttgart, May 22, 1871, possibly lot 1837; sale organized by Clément, Paris, May 1878 (?); Adalbert von Lanna [1836-1909, Lugt 2773]; sale of his collection, Stuttgart, May 11-22, 1909, lot 1787; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.

bibliography.boilertext: F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).
bibliography.citation:
F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).

, no. 285

bibliography.boilertext: Otto Hirschmann and E. W. Moes, Hendrik Goltzius, Verzeichnis des graphischen Werks (Braunschweig: Klinkhardt & Biermann, 1976).
bibliography.citation: Otto Hirschmann and E. W. Moes, Hendrik Goltzius, Verzeichnis des graphischen Werks (Braunschweig: Klinkhardt & Biermann, 1976)., no. 285

bibliography.boilertext: Marjolein Leesberg, "Hendrick Goltzius," New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts, 1450-1700 (Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel: Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, 2012).
bibliography.citation: Marjolein Leesberg, "Hendrick Goltzius," New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts, 1450-1700 (Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel: Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, 2012)., no. 230, pp. 86–87 (illus.)
